On a re-reading of code -- prompted by a kick from our Igor -- Heritrix 
is doing as you first suppose in your message below: If 'bot1' is the 
User-agent and in Heritrix, the User-agent string is 'Mozilla/5.0 
(compatible; bot1 +http://myUrl)', then Heritrix will read the 
subsequent allows/disallows as referring to it.

http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/Robotstxt.html#38 
is where we parse the robots.txt. 

http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/RobotsExclusionPolicy.html#147 
<http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/RobotsExclusionPolicy.html#147,> 
on line 166 is where we look into the Heritrix user-agent for any 
instance of what is specified on a User-agent line in robots.txt.

Sorry for any confusion.

St.Ack
